programme.title: It's Sew Easy
programme.desc: Our material girls, Angela Wolf, Ellen March and Ebony Love have some great fabrics choices as they take three projects step by step. Angela moves to our first lesson on the trendy top and front placket, then it’s a fun new fabric – cork on a tote bag with Ellen. We finish with a quilt project featuring last week’s block with Ebony.

programme.title: It's Sew Easy
programme.desc: Be ready to go -- anywhere, anytime. Sewing blogger and busy Mom Caroline Critchfield stays packed and ready with a handy bag made with clear vinyl and colorful fabric. Award-winning quilter Carolina Moore takes along paper-piecing projects so she can keep stitching wherever she goes. Alex Woodbury shares a charity sewing project.

programme.title: Beads, Baubles & Jewels
programme.desc: India has its own original look, or we should say multiple looks! Whether bold jewel tones, musical metals and bells, or a more mystical element, this is a style easily recognized. Kate Richbourg demonstrates Bollywood bracelets. Then Kim O'Neill introduces us to prayer beads or malas - a traditional tool used to count the number of times a mantra is recited, or breaths while meditating.

programme.title: Beads, Baubles & Jewels
programme.desc: Personalize your style with custom colors. Author and designer Cathy Jakicic weaves beaded components and makes them multifunctional. Teens and tweens will love to make the charm necklace that Candie Cooper creates as she joins Katie Hacker in Katie's Beading Lesson.

programme.title: Scrapbook Soup
programme.desc: Every occasion no matter how big or small deserves a card – and today we've got designs for everyday occasions. Today's soup includes lacy pop up cards with a graphic design, some tasty treat cards featuring a lemonade stand with Sara Naumann, and translating a layout into a card with Nancy Nally. Lots of cards and ingredients in one Scrapbook Soup.

programme.title: Make It Artsy
programme.sub-title: In the Eyes of an Artist
programme.desc: An artist sees things differently -- they have a unique way of looking at the world and interpreting it into art. First, we look at Mary Cassatt, an American painter and printmaker known for her portrayal of women and children and create a project showing the bonds between mother and child. Using a totally different perspective, Joe Rotella, creates a kaleidoscope guaranteed to alter the way you see the world. We finish up with Ardith Goodwin and a Kandinsky inspired work -- starting with a photo of a house and using chalk and neon to create her canvas.

programme.title: Knitting
programme.desc: Learn to knit with CraftsyTV.

programme.title: Knitting
programme.desc: Learn to knit with CraftsyTV.

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: Mistakes happen, even for the Midnight Quilter. But hey, the show must go on! Tune in to see how Angela conquers a little stitch snafu on her way to sewing a scrappy square-in-square stunner, just in time for her family reunion.

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: This practical and cute quilted zipper pouch is one of Angela's favorite projects yet, because it skips the piecing and gets straight to the quilting! In this episode, she shares three quilting designs every quilter should know: ribbon candy, serpentine lines and the paisley feather, while making a small, easy quilting project for beginners that only requires two fat quarters to make!

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: Angela ponders on her new year's resolutions as she builds a curved log cabin quilt using ombré fabric.

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: This four-patch variation with cornerstones is the talk of the town! Watch Angela as she plays with color and dot-to-dot quilting.

programme.title: Butter Book
programme.desc: Learn to bake and cook with CraftsyTV.

programme.title: Craft Hacks
programme.desc: Time-saving quick tips to feed your crafting craving.

programme.title: It's Sew Easy
programme.desc: Sewing experts offer easy ways to create neat sewing projects right at home. Viewers of all skill levels learn tips and techniques for creating professional-looking garments, personalized apparel and home accents. Weekly episodes feature various themes, and feature two main projects and one shorter technique segment. Some projects include monogramming napkins and towels; baby poncho, hooded towel and baby-friendly diapers; embellishing yoga pants with a clothing tattoo; and sewing on knits.

programme.title: Slow TV
programme.desc: Take it slow with this model railroad tour.

programme.title: Man About Cake
programme.desc: Sink your teeth into current cake decorating trends! In the Man About Cake series, Joshua John Russell delivers incredible tips for creating modern edible masterpieces. Each week, he decorates an original cake, shares his favorite recipes and gives pointers for designing like a pro.

programme.title: Man About Cake
programme.desc: These monsters just dropped in to say HAPPY BIRTHDAY!

programme.title: Anti-Valentine's Cake
programme.desc: JJR is celebrating Valentine's Day (a little) differently this year. If you're feeling anti-Valentine's yourself, get the recipes and everything you need to make this cake!

programme.title: Man About Cake
programme.desc: Get scandalous with naked cakes. JJR bares it all and makes a rustic naked cake with flowers & a pop of pink buttercream filling.

programme.title: Man About Cake
programme.desc: Guess what? You likely own everything needed to make this glamorous cake! Bust out those cutters and slay some metallic cakes with JJR.

programme.title: Cook Once, Eat Twice
programme.desc: Learn to bake and cook with CraftsyTV.

programme.title: Garden Party
programme.desc: Ready to dig in and grow your green thumb? Join us for a delightful hour of expert-led gardening tutorials designed to inspire and educate gardeners of all levels. From essential planting tips and soil secrets to creative container gardening and vibrant floral arrangements, our seasoned instructors will guide you through every step. Whether you're a seasoned horticulturist or just starting out, you'll find fresh ideas and practical techniques to cultivate the garden of your dreams.

programme.title: Hands On Crafts for Kids
programme.desc: People come in all shapes and sizes. The first project uses papier mache and garden gloves to create cowboy and girl puppets. Next, decorate your own flip flops. Draw faces in your art journal without even lifting your pencil off the page. And finally, create clothespin action figures of all kinds from ninjas -- to fairies.

programme.title: Hands On Crafts for Kids
programme.desc: People come in all shapes and sizes. The first project uses papier mache and garden gloves to create cowboy and girl puppets. Next, decorate your own flip flops. Draw faces in your art journal without even lifting your pencil off the page. And finally, create clothespin action figures of all kinds from ninjas -- to fairies.

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.sub-title: Bonus: Top 3 Free-Motion Quilting Designs Even Beginners Can Do
programme.desc: Machine quilting isn't always as easy as it looks, but anyone can do these three free-motion quilting designs (promise)! Learn how wavy lines, starburst designs, and simple cursive words can turn your quilt into a work of art.

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: Angela creates a modern Southwestern-style quilt that's the perfect size to use as a blanket for summer picnics in the park.

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.sub-title: Bonus: Tips for Avoiding Bulky Seams
programme.desc: Sometimes bulky seams can't be avoided, but DON'T panic! Angela has a few tips for how to deal with this quilting conundrum.

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.sub-title: Bonus: Tips for Avoiding Bulky Seams
programme.desc: Sometimes bulky seams can't be avoided, but DON'T panic! Angela has a few tips for how to deal with this quilting conundrum.

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: Are you an organized quilter or a bit on the messier side like Angela? Watch as she uses solid colors to make a tried-and-true rainbow quilt by Monique Jacobs, sharing her best organizing tips along the way.

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: Angela loves to stock up on fabrics. From bundles to collections, get her tips to pick the perfect prints and solids for your next quilt.

programme.desc: Time-saving quick tips to feed your crafting craving.

programme.title: Butter Book
programme.desc: Learn to bake and cook with CraftsyTV.

programme.title: It's Sew Easy
programme.desc: Transform what's old into something new. Designer Angela Wolf upcycles an ordinary sweater to make it new again. Then, she sews the sleeves and the sides of the denim dress. Blogger and sewing teacher Joanne Banko uses scarves and lightweight fabrics to create a flowing and fashionable kimono-style blouse.

programme.title: It's Sew Easy
programme.desc: On this show, piecework like you've never seen it before -- as traditional quilting meets fashion. Think a little outside of the box as Angela Wolf makes a color block dress that's really just a variation on a large patchwork design. Then, quilter Jeni Baker demonstrates piecework on a smaller scale with a half square quilt perfect for beginners.

programme.title: Off Our Needles
programme.desc: Beat single sock syndrome with a little multitasking! The girls go over how to knit two socks at once so you'll never end up with solo socks again.

programme.title: Off Our Needles
programme.sub-title: Fresh for Spring: Knitted Boot Liners, Jewel-tone Shawls & Brioche Police
programme.desc: Time for a little spring fling! Join the Grocery Girls as they gear up for warmer weather by chatting lace, their favorite Instagrammers and even a few tales of love. Well, sort of.

programme.title: Hands On Crafts for Kids
programme.desc: Every day is play time! Challenge your skills with an ice cream cone ball toss game. Design your own indoor miniature golf course with Franz, then put on a show with puppets Jenny shows how to make and decorate. Add some cardboard to the Family Craft Box to create a super mask and make your own superhero figure.

programme.desc: Sink your teeth into current cake decorating trends! In the Man About Cake series, Joshua John Russell delivers incredible tips for creating modern edible masterpieces. Each week, he decorates an original cake, shares his favorite recipes and gives pointers for designing like a pro.

programme.title: Man About Cake
programme.desc: Watch JJR make ombré fondant ruffles and stud this cake with incredible custom "gems."

programme.title: Mother's Day Gift Box Cake
programme.desc: Yo mama's so sweet...We made a cake for her! Tune in as JJR whips up a gorgeous gift box cake that might make up for all those grey hairs you gave Mom.

programme.title: Man About Cake
programme.desc: An all-white cake doesn't have to be plain. JJR is back and bolder than ever with this four-tier white monochrome wedding cake.

programme.title: Man About Cake
programme.desc: Guess what? You likely own everything needed to make this glamorous cake! Bust out those cutters and slay some metallic cakes with JJR.

programme.title: Woodworkers Guild of America presented by CraftsyTV
programme.desc: -Cordless drills are a staple in many woodworking shops and deserve a dedicated storage stand. George Vondriska shows you how to make your own cordless drill stand, fully equipped with a power strip for easy charging, plus storage drawers for tips and bits. This project is great for practicing biscuit joinery and hand tool work.

programme.title: Fresh Quilting
programme.desc: Explore your inner child and let them out during playtime on this episode of Fresh Quilting. Steph Skardal encourages playing with color starting with paper before even adding fabric. Then, Catherine Cureton plays around with a mini quilt to turn it into a functional pillow. Eliane Bergmann has a machine tip on presser feet - when do you raise and when do you lower – what is that knob on your machine?

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: Angela loves to stock up on fabrics. From bundles to collections, get her tips to pick the perfect prints and solids for your next quilt.

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: Have you ever worked on a quilt that seemed intimidating, but wasn't that bad once you got into it? Watch as Angela checks this snazzy Snail's Trail quilt from her quilting bucket list.

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: Angela's got stars in her eyes this week as she pieces together the eight-pointed star Twinkling Twilight quilt by Nancy Smith.

programme.title: It's Sew Easy
programme.desc: Today's show looks at a few classic details. Amy Alan has a serger lesson. She reviews the basic serger stitches and teaches when to use them and tension adjustments for each. Then, Angela Wolf introduces princess seams -- why you use them, how to adjust for fit, and then how to sew them. Finally, Kenneth D. King has a couture technique for curved tucks on a fabulous top.
